author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Confederation of Real Estate Developers Association of India (CREDAI), Tiruchi, will organise a housing exhibition, ‘Fairpro 2016,’ at Hotel Sangam in the city from January 8 to 10.

About 28 leading flat promoters and builders will showcase over 100 projects during the expo.

The expo will offer ready-to-occupy apartments and individual villas, in the range of Rs.10 lakhs to Rs.1 crore, to enable visitors select from a wide range of choices, said M.Noor Mohamed, chairman, Fairpro 2016.

Six banks have come forward to accord spot sanction of housing loan with some concessions at the expo venue. All projects would conform to building plan approvals and rules. Site visits would be arranged. Given the expectations on Tiruchi being developed as a second capital of the state and the city being selected for the Smart City project, the city offers a safe investment opportunity for buyers. CREDAI was expecting a spurt in sale in view of these developments, Mr.Noor Mohamed said addressing a press conference here on Tuesday

The exhibition would seek to create awareness of latest technologies in the construction industry, technologies to be adopted for environment protection and transparency in transactions.

B.Senthil Kumar, president, and S.Anand, secretary, CREDAI, Tiruchi, were present.
title: Housing expo in Tiruchi
